title: Garlic Mashed Potatoes
ingredients: 3¾  pounds of red-skinned potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
2 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary or 2 teaspoons dried
1 cup (or more) canned, low-salt chicken broth, heated to a simmer
instructions: Cook potatoes and the garlic in a large pot of boiling, salted water until both are very tender, about 30 minutes.  Drain.

Transfer the potatoes and garlic to a large bowl.  Then, using an electric mixer, beat the potatoes and garlic.  Add the butter and chopped rosemary and continue beating until smooth.  Add one cup of the warm broth gradually until the consistency of the potatoes is to your personal preference.  Stir in the Parmesan and add the salt and pepper to taste.  Serve warm.

Remarks:  The potatoes may be prepared up to 2 hours ahead.  Keep covered.  They may be re-warmed in a heavy, large saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring often, adding more warm broth if the mashed potatoes are too dry.
Source:  The Tastes of Autumn, Betty Rosbottom, Bon Appétit, October 1994.
